quiz.text:
Which of the following students can avail benefits from the above scheme?  

A. A student who has secured admission in University abroad to pursue Post Graduate Diploma. 

B. A student who has taken the loan from a Bank who is not a member of Indian Banks Association. 

C. A student whose overall family income exceedingly not more than 6 lakhs per annum.
options: A and B only
B only
A and C only
B and C only
A, B and C

quiz.text: The interest subsidy provided by the scheme is given till what period after the course completion?
options: 12 months or 6-months after getting a job (whichever is earlier)
18 months or 6-months after getting a job (whichever is earlier)
10 months or 6-months after getting a job (whichever is earlier)
20 months or 6-months after getting a job (whichever is earlier)
24 months or 6-months after getting a job (whichever is earlier)

quiz.text:
For which of the following courses the benefit can be availed from the above scheme? 

A. Masters 

B. Ph.D 

C. M.Phil
options: A and B only
B and C only
B only
A and C only
A, B and C

quiz.text: The Ministry of Minority Affairs (MoMA) has discontinued the scheme from ________.
options: 2026-27
2025-26
2024-25
2023-24
2022-23

quiz.text: Which one of the following is the designated nodal bank for the above mentioned scheme?
options: HDFC Bank
ICICI Bank
Punjab National Bank

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the components of Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana? 

A. Shishu - covering loans up to Rs. 50,000 

B. Kishor - covering loans above Rs. 50,000 and upto 5 lakhs 

C. Tarun - covering loans above Rs. 5 lakh and upto 20 lakhs
options: A and B only
B and C only
A and C only
A, B and C
None of the Above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to PM-MUDRA Yojana?
options: No processing fee or collateral is required
Repayment period of loan is extended up to 5 years
Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFC) are exempted from MUDRA Yojana
A debit card (MUDRA Card) is also issued against the MUDRA loan account.
The Scheme is being managed by National Credit Guarantee Trustee Company Ltd. (NCGTC)

quiz.text: Swachh Bharat Mission-Urban 2.0 was launched with the vision of creating Garbage Free Cities by the year _________.
options: 2023
2024
2025
2026
2027

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to SBM-U 2.0?
options: It is a centrally sponsored scheme.
This scheme is being run by Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
It utilizes 3R (reduce, reuse, recycle)
All statutory towns are covered under this scheme
Total financial outlay under SBM-U 2.0 is Rs. 1,20,000 crore

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement with respect to SBM(U) 2.0 –
options: Construction of over 3.5 lakhs individual, community and public toilets
SBM-U 2.0 focuses on sustaining the sanitation and solid waste management
Complete liquid waste management in cities with less than 1 lakh population
Central government to contribute the funds equal to Rs 26,465 crores
Remediation of all legacy dumpsites will also be done under the mission

quiz.text: What is the fund allocation ratio (Centre:State) in the case of million plus Urban Local Bodies (ULBs)?
options: 80% : 20%
25% : 75%
33% : 67%
90% : 10%
50% : 50%

quiz.text: Recently (May 2022), union government has approved continuation of Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Program (PMEGP) over the 15th Finance Commission Cycle for five years (2021-22 to 2025-26) with an outlay of Rs. ______ Crore.
options: 11219.14
12409.29
13554.42
14798.63
15317.97

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements are correct with respect to PMEGP? 

A. PMEGP is a Central Sector Scheme. 

B. Maximum project cost for manufacturing sector is limited to Rs. 50 lakh 

C. Units that are minimum 5 years old can avail the assistance under PMEGP  

D. Subsidy rate under general category is 25% of cost of the project for rural areas, and 15% for urban areas
options: A, B and C
A, B and D
B, C and D
A, C and D
All of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are eligible under PMEGP Scheme? 

A. Individuals above 18 years of Age 

B. Co-operative Societies, SHG and Charitable Trusts 

C. Institutions registered under Societies Registration Act - 1860 

D. Candidate should have acquired minimum qualification of VIII Std for projects above Rs. 5 lakh in manufacturing sector.
options: A, B, D
A, C, D
A, B, C, D
B, C, D
A, B, C

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to the above scheme?
options: Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) is the nodal agency at national level
There is no income ceiling for setting up projects
Per capita investment should not exceed Rs 1 lakh for plain areas and Rs 1.5 lakh for hilly areas
As per RBI guidelines, project costing up to Rs. 5 lakhs under PMEGP loans are free from collateral security
Applicants from Aspirational districts & Transgenders have been included under the Special Category applicants for availing higher subsidies

quiz.text:
Which of the following are the objectives of the Pradhan Mantri Anusuchit Jati Abhyuday Yojana? 

A. Reduce poverty of the SC communities by generation of additional employment opportunities 

B. To improve socio-economic developmental indicators by ensuring adequate infrastructure and requisite services in the SC dominated villages. 

C. To increase literacy and encourage enrolment of SCs in schools.
options: A and B only
B and C only
C only
A and C only
A, B and C

quiz.text: Which of the following are correct with reference to the Pradhan Mantri Anusuchit Jati Abhyuday Yojana (PM – AJAY)?
options: The Scheduled Castes persons living below the poverty lines are eligible for getting benefits under the scheme.
In case of Infrastructure Development, the villages having 70% or more SC population are eligible for grants under the Scheme.
It is a centrally sponsored scheme.
All of the above
Only 1 and 2

quiz.text: Which of the following schemes were merged into PM AJAY?

Babu Jagjivan Ram Chhatrawas Yojana
Special Central Assistance to Scheduled Castes Sub Plan

All 1, 2 and 3
